info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EASTERN BELMONT...SOUTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHWESTERN GREENE...NORTHWESTERN MONONGALIA...OHIO... NORTHEASTERN WETZEL AND MARSHALL COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 430 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Triadelphia, moving south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Moundsville, Bellaire, Bethlehem, Triadelphia, Shadyside, McMechen, Cameron, Hundred, Benwood, Aleppo, New Freeport, and Grove Oak. This includes Interstate 70 in West Virginia between mile markers 7 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
